title: One man and another is in a critical condition in horror hang gliding accident in Lennox Head
text:
One man is dead and another is fighting for life after falling from a hang glider on the NSW north coast.

Paramedics were called to Moreton Lookout at Lennox Head, just after midday on Wednesday after reports the men had fallen from the hang glider before it crashed.

Bystanders managed to make their way to the injured men and began CPR, however one of the men - believed to be a 67-year-old instructor- died at the scene.

A man, 67, is dead and another, 26, is fighting for his life after falling from a hang glider at the Moreton Lookout at Lennox Head (pictured)

The other man, a 26-year-old, has been winched out and airlifted to Gold Coast Hospital in a critical condition.

'This was an extremely complex rescue for paramedics and emergency services due to the surrounding terrain and location of where the hang-glider crashed,' NSW Ambulance Inspector Greg Powell said in a statement.

'We always do everything we can to try and get the best patient outcome, but unfortunately, in this instance there was nothing more we could do. It was an extremely tragic accident and understandably everyone involved is devastated.

A report will be prepared for the coroner.
description: Paramedics were called to Moreton Lookout at Lennox Head, just after midday on Wednesday after reports the men had fallen from the hang glider before it crashed.
authors: Paula Ahillon For Daily Mail Australia
